intro: Galium fluminense, commonly known as riverbed bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetland and riparian habitats. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its roots are fibrous and help stabilize soil in moist environments. Galium fluminense is often found in areas with standing water or saturated soil, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
